Sentencas: The critical role of materials science and engineering in the development of fuel cell technology is surveyed.
Titulo: Material science and engineering: The enabling technology for the commercialisation of fuel cell systems

Sentencas: The inability to fabricate reliable triple-phase-boundary (tbp) structures involving electrolytes, electronic conductors, and gaseous reactants, severely restricted the progress of fuel cells until about four decades ago (similar to 1960).
Titulo: Material science and engineering: The enabling technology for the commercialisation of fuel cell systems

Sentencas: However at the start of the new millennium, commercialisation of four fuel cell types: polymeric electrolyte membrane (PEMFC), phosphoric acid (PAFC), molten carbonate (MCFC), and solid oxide (SOFC), is now being very energetically pursued.
Titulo: Material science and engineering: The enabling technology for the commercialisation of fuel cell systems

Sentencas: Materials selection for each type of fuel cell is briefly examined, and the predominant engineering issues related to the development of commercial products are summarised.
Titulo: Material science and engineering: The enabling technology for the commercialisation of fuel cell systems

Sentencas: The fabrication, reliability, and cost of the relevant materials is of paramount importance to ensure rapid market penetration.
Titulo: Material science and engineering: The enabling technology for the commercialisation of fuel cell systems

Sentencas: The choice of fuel and relevant infrastructure is also considered, and the crucial role of materials for energy storage (particularly hydrogen) and fuel processing, is emphasised.
Titulo: Material science and engineering: The enabling technology for the commercialisation of fuel cell systems
